trans-unit.source: The instructions below apply to updating a Windows Store client app but, you can test this on any of the other platforms supported by Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: The instructions below apply to updating a Windows Store client app but, you can test this on any of the other platforms supported by Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open MainPage.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statement to the top of the file.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open MainPage.xaml.cs and add the following `using` statement to the top of the file.

trans-unit.source: In MainPage.xaml.cs, add the following class definition to the namespace to help serialize the user information.
trans-unit.target: In MainPage.xaml.cs, add the following class definition to the namespace to help serialize the user information.

trans-unit.source: In MainPage.xaml.cs, update the `AuthenticateAsync` method to call the custom API to return additional information about the user from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In MainPage.xaml.cs, update the `AuthenticateAsync` method to call the custom API to return additional information about the user from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: Save your changes and build the the service to verify no syntax errors.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes and build the the service to verify no syntax errors.
